notes: NIST 800-171 R3 control 03.01.01 is the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R2 3.1.1, with updated control ID format
CMMC L2 AC.L2-3.1.1 implements the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R3 03.01.01 to limit system access to authorized users
CIS 3.3 (Configure Data Access Control Lists) implements the requirement to limit system access to authorized users
CIS 13.9 (Deploy Port-Level Access Control) supports the requirement to limit system access to authorized users through network-level controls
NIST 800-171 R3 control 03.01.02 is the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R2 3.1.2, with updated control ID format
CMMC L2 AC.L2-3.1.2 implements the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R3 03.01.02 to limit system access to authorized transactions and functions
CIS 3.3 (Configure Data Access Control Lists) implements the requirement to limit system access to authorized transactions and functions
NIST 800-171 R3 control 03.01.05 is the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R2 3.1.5, with updated control ID format
CMMC L2 AC.L2-3.1.5 implements the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R3 03.01.05 to employ the principle of least privilege
CIS 6.8 (Define and Maintain Role-Based Access Control) implements the principle of least privilege through role-based access control
CIS 12.2 (Establish and Maintain a Secure Network Architecture) supports the principle of least privilege at the network level
NIST 800-171 R3 control 03.01.10 is the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R2 3.1.11, with updated control ID format
CMMC L2 AC.L2-3.1.11 implements the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R3 03.01.10 to terminate user sessions after defined conditions
CIS 4.3 (Configure Automatic Session Locking on Enterprise Assets) implements the requirement to terminate sessions after periods of inactivity
NIST 800-171 R3 control 03.02.01 is the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R2 3.2.1, with updated control ID format
CMMC L2 AT.L2-3.2.1 implements the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R3 03.02.01 for security awareness
CIS 14.1 (Establish and Maintain a Security Awareness Program) directly implements the requirements for security awareness
CIS 14.2 (Train Workforce Members to Recognize Social Engineering Attacks) addresses a specific aspect of security awareness training
NIST 800-171 R3 control 03.05.07 is the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R2 3.5.10, with updated control ID format
CMMC L2 IA.L2-3.5.10 implements the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R3 03.05.07 for cryptographically-protected passwords
CIS 5.2 (Use Unique Passwords) is related to the requirement for password protection but focuses on uniqueness rather than cryptographic protection
NIST 800-171 R3 control 03.08.03 is the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R2 3.8.3, with updated control ID format
CMMC L1 MP.L1-3.8.3 implements the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R3 03.08.03 for secure disposal of media
CIS 3.5 (Securely Dispose of Data) directly implements the requirement to securely dispose of media containing sensitive data
NIST 800-171 R3 control 03.14.01 is the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R2 3.14.1, with updated control ID format
CMMC L1 SI.L1-3.14.1 implements the same requirement as NIST 800-171 R3 03.14.01 for identifying and correcting system flaws
CIS 7.7 (Remediate Detected Vulnerabilities) addresses the remediation aspect of the requirement to identify, report, and correct system flaws
CIS 12.1 (Ensure Network Infrastructure is Up-to-Date) supports the requirement by ensuring network components are updated to address known flaws
